name: Jumeirah Carlton Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to head if you expect good service. The lounge was a little overrun for afternoon drinks and service was slow but other than that it was tip top. Great room, junior suite, with wonderful views over the park...and of course shopping on the doorstep.
reviews.title: Great service and location

reviews.text: The highlight was the best massage ever..... Worth it for that alone!
reviews.title: Business

reviews.text: Location is perfect , from the minute I checked in until the minute I checked out , the service I got was really fantastic , staff was really helpful and very well trained , hospitality was over my expectation , for sure I go there again.
reviews.title: Great time at the Carlton Tower

reviews.text: We stayed here on the way back from Dubai where we'd had a disappointing stay at the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray. Luckily for us the Jumeirah group redeemed themselves totally with this property. Perfect location, great service wonderful (expensive) food and attention to detail that is second to none! We are coming back for a couple of nights in February without my toddler and can't wait.
reviews.title: London from Jumeirah's Eyes

reviews.text: I was in the UK for a short business trip in Scarborough for testing a machine before shipping to Dubai. I made some suggestions to the factory and expected their work to complete in three days. There wasnt much to do other than wait, so I decided to head to London.
reviews.title: The Carlton Tower Hotel is not what it used to be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not writing this as a hotelier but as a guest of a hotel, the Jumeirah Carlton Tower. This is always my choice of hotels in my frequent visits to London for both buiness and pleasure. This is the first time I have thought of reviewing an establishment, particularly from one hotelier to another. On this occcasion I must express my total satisfaction of a product. You can always tell a place is special with the continuity of staff. The many years I have stayed at this hotel, the same cheerful, helpful and happy staff are there on hand.In particular the doormen, bell boys and breakfast personnel in the rib room. Eventhough they deal with hundreds of guests each week, the service team always make you feel as though you are the first and only one they are looking after. For location, guest satisfaction and overall special place to stay, I have no hesitation in reccommending this as a hotel of choice.
reviews.title: Fellow hotelier

reviews.text: The reception staff were friendly and accommodating. I was upgraded to the deluxe room upon arrival without asking, which was a pleasant surprise. The room was spacious, nicely designed and with very comfy bed. REN cosmetics in the bathroom. For concierge guys nothing was too much trouble. Around the corner from Sloane Street, 5 mins walk from Harrods. Breakfast really very good with massive choice for buffet. True 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the best location ( for shopping)

reviews.text: While more a business hotel, and much in need of a style update, the location can't be beat for those wanting to be in central London. The food is surprisingly good - room service included and it has one of the top gyms and pools in town. Walking distance to all the best shops, it's also conveniently located near two main tube stops and easy access to the city's sites and museums - not to mention a 5 minute walk to Hyde Park.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: Well the hotel is great and in a very important shopping location....
reviews.title: I had a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very small lobby compared to other 5 star hotels.
reviews.title: I expected a bit more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I decided to surprise my husband with a weekend stay at this hotel as we always stay at the jumeirah beach hotel in Dubai and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Husbands birthday

reviews.text: I had e mailed the hotel before our stay to say it was my husbands birthday and when we arrived our room had been upgraded and when we got to the room we found champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us. From start to finish they could not do enough for us. We ate in the rib room that evening and that was everything we thought it would be.
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea

reviews.text: We would like to thanks Kristina for all her help in booking this trip and making it special.
reviews.title: PURE LUXURY, GREAT LOCATION

reviews.text: Would we return.......of course we would....we cannot wait to return.
reviews.title: Favourite hotel in London

reviews.text: Came here for afternoon tea with my daughter, what a wonderful place, relaxing time with the harpist playing in the background, the designs of the cakes are truly delightful, rich and full of flavour, scones still hot.
reviews.title: 3x's in 2 mo's worth a review

reviews.text: I can't honestly fault this hotel.
reviews.title: Quiet, classy and easy to access

reviews.text: The rooms are regular size for London - read, not massive, not claustrophobic either. They are quiet, well appointed, had nice amenities and an Nespresso Machine which was super. Room was spotless. The room faced the park right in front of the hotel. The staff was all very welcoming and efficient. The hotel is located two minutes walk from Knightsbridge tube station which is quite convenient really. Knightsbridge is not the most alive neighbourhood of course, more of a residential and posh part of town. Harrods' and Sloan Streets are just around the corner. I redeemed points for this stayed so didn't pay a cent. Recommended if you can afford it.
reviews.title: Why can't 5 star hotels get breakfast right?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Top Location. Our basic (recently re-modelled) room was very comfortable with opening windows. Luxurious bathroom, no bath. Nespresso coffee machine but only 2 pods!! Ask for fresh milk, only UHT in the room. Wish hotels would just stick fresh milk in the fridge. Warm welcome at the front desk, but other staff we met surly, lacking in motivation. Front of house at the restaurant just plain rude.
reviews.title: Quietly Classy

reviews.text: So all very nice but why can't posh hotels ever get breakfast right. 45 minutes for a cold poached egg. Sent it back and made do with mediocre buffet.
reviews.title: Good but could be Great

reviews.text: Could do better for the £££££
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location but Small Standard Rooms

reviews.text: From the moment you arrive in your car the excellent experience of staying at the Jumeriah Carlton Hotel begins.
reviews.title: Great Knightsbridge Location!
Well designed room
reviews.text: The hotel has an excellent lounge and restaurant. Service in all respects is very good. The gym on the 9 th floor is top notch and well staffed. I especially liked my room; plenty of light switches and all lights in the room could be controlled from the bed. Nice coffee maker and well stocked mini-bar. The heating/air system is simple, and unlike many European hotels, is actually controlled by the guest and not preset. The shower has a huge shower head with plenty of pressure. Very comfortable and well designed.

Stayed for two nights and I've got to say that I was fairly underwhelmed by the entire experience. For me personally, it was just a fancy travel lodge. I had the healthy breakfasting my room and the quantity and quality of the produce was poor - which at £40 all in was a rip-off. Even though the company was paying, I actually chose to grab something at pret and save the company money and eat nicer produce.
reviews.title: Really average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were of average quality and certainly not comparable to true "luxury hotels"
reviews.title: Fantastic 3 night stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location and fantastically helpful porter but was disgusted to see a £10/per day surcharge added for "services" again the company was paying but I wasn't going to waste their money on cheeky items like this. As I say, I find it cheeky and half the time on business don't even check the bill and wouldn't of normally noticed the skim.
reviews.title: I'm sure 5 star used to mean a whole lot more
London Olympics 2012
reviews.text: Free Internet is a bonus

Great location right off Sloane street ( for those who want Knightsbridge ). Hotel in itself is quite neutral, no fussy decor. The majority of the clients are mainly middle-eastern. Reception, concierge and most of staff were courteous, polite and somewhat helpful.
reviews.title: Convenient and nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym is very nice and the pool is one of the best in London. Spa treatments are ok but it seems it's not their forte, there are better places around for that.
reviews.title: Excellent Reception upon Arrival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are nice but the superior ones are too small, be sure to get a deluxe one as i did, on a high floor with a gardens vue, amazing.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also they can be noisy, since you can hear anything in the hallway. The whole place is like this. The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable tough, noise aside i had top quality sleep.
reviews.title: Great weekend break

reviews.text: Free wi-fi internet never works!!! I complained about it several times, they kept on saying that they verified it but never the less it never worked ( same in my mother and sister's rooms ).
reviews.title: Fantastic!

description: The five-star Jumeirah Carlton Tower is ideally situated amongst the boutique stores of Knightsbridge and Sloane Street. Each of the 216 rooms and suites have been designed with luxury in mind, each benefiting from complimentary high speed wired and wireless internet access. The hotel features three restaurants and bars; The Rib Room Bar & Restaurant, Chinoiserie and The Club Room. The Peak Health Club & Spa boasts state-of-the-art gym equipment, golf simulator, aerobics studio, award-winning treatments and 20m indoor pool.
